text:
[Section: SPRING 2024 PARENT MEETING: ON ZOOM]



Every season LOCALHOOPS has a Parent Meeting to discuss Academy details such as: Schedule overview, gameplay, training options and
development plans
Spring Season 2024 'Parent Meeting' will be held on Sunday, March 17th @ 7:15PM.  Please save the Zoom Link below:

Register Here
We look forward to seeing you in the gym!
Micah Mitchell
Lions League Director

Training@localhoops.org
LOCALHOOPS Training Academy
localhoopsacademy@gmail.com • (425) 531-9000
https://www.localhoops.org/

now.

Message 2054 of 4024
I am working on the parenting plan now. I actually have a lot of updates now that I have seen the entire document and how they interact with
different sections.
It has sections for summer and holidays that need to be hashed out in mediation and not in this doc. I also have changes to major decision making
should you violate the ro or relapse. How it was drafted does not make sense in totality.
I know you will be frustrated by my changes but now that I have the full document, I need to make adjustments knowing this is what is intended just
to get us to July 12.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 10:50 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 11:05 AM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

I am willing to work with you so hope you see that in that spirit.
You also had kids spending spring break with you this year.
I haven’t paid much attention to the financial side but now that we are close to finalizing PP, it is a natural progression of next steps.
We probably have a different opinion of what future spousal support looks like. Child payments are just a formula.
I haven’t taken time to pull together documents for asset split or spousal but am just starting to think about it.
Message 2055 of 4024
I wasn’t expecting you to stick to the agreement you made. And I asked you very clearly if I could just send it to you before Lisa but you balked. Not
sure why since now we have wasted days and may be at in impasse again for no reason.
And of course now that me actually having permission to see the kids I have 50/50 custody of is going to be legalized you would shift to how I pay for
your lifestyle as I have done for all these years. Nothing in this whole thing surprises me.
Actually, Kevin did surprise me.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 11:10 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 11:37 AM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2056 of 4024
I realize now in our 1:1 setting, I feel anxious and get pushed to agreeing to things. I ask not to do them and communicate that. I try to wrap the
conversation or discussion as quickly as possible. Once in calmer environment, without your influence, I am able to think clearly.
If there are situations that require limitations, as in our case, it is not 50/50. That is why we are negotiating this PP.
Bringing up Kevin is disappointing. I have avoided responding and addressing when you have brought up on numerous occasions in the past, but will
address for one last time.
Reference to Kevin is harassment and disturbance of the peace in violation of the RO. RO states communications are limited to co parenting or
shared assets.
Given the space of 8 months to reflect on what happened, I disagree with the characterization of an affair. That is not a fact. You made me agree to
something after months of yelling and your view of what happened. I did not disclose the picture to you when asked, but that does mean it was an
affair. I would characterize it as a friendly interaction.
I don’t consider that issue as something that relates to our co parenting or shared assets. And will not engage in that discussion any further. If you
choose to do so, you know my perspective on that topic and intersection with RO.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 12:01 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 12:12 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

Message 2057 of 4024
Let’s make some time today/tonight to discuss your thoughts. I’m sure you have a reasonable explanation for your suggestions. So I’m all ears. If we
can do that today we will save a lot of time and $$$.
As you said- we can do this! Just let me know when so we do it before you go dark again, please!
Sent:03/10/2024 at 12:20 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 12:34 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

I appreciate and support your interest in Max.
Let’s get the reunification therapy started so he can start processing and working on his relationship with you.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 12:37 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 12:52 PM)
Subject:Max/Robotics
Message 2059 of 4024
Thank you for your measured response.
As shared, if I do agree to discuss, I am not going to fight it out.
Ground rules:
Listen to my modification’s.
I can listen to your feedback if shared in a measured hand non confrontational way.
No discussion on feelings, past, desires to reunify, disappointments on where we are.
If we disagree, I highlight what you disagree with and lawyers to negotiate.
If you do agree then we can leave as is.
Sound good?
Sent:03/10/2024 at 12:43 PM
From:Christine Moyer

Message 2061 of 4024
What is going on? We are serving them breakfast next week. I never miss a single thing he does. What has gone on that we could go from playing and
cuddling the last time I was there while you were in New York to him running in fear from me. This is fucked up
Sent:03/10/2024 at 12:55 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 12:57 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Robotics
Message 2062 of 4024
I’ll leave that up to you. I am uncertain how to navigate.
TBH in my opinion, it shows you are supportive of him, and have interest in him.
Perhaps just give him space but he sees you are there.
He will remember the intent was there, and perhaps reframe in his mind, once you work together on the dynamic.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 12:57 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 12:57 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Robotics
Message 2063 of 4024
See prior message.
My perspective (I am not a professional)  is he is scared of showing you in person, but has now been allowed to process the trauma and past and
validate how he felt in that moment.
Similar to when Adrian texted you about why you did all those things from those vacations, he needs to understand it too.
That’s why reunification therapy is so important in my mind.
Just my two cents.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 01:01 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 01:02 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Robotics

Message 2064 of 4024
So I think the first rule of a healthy negotiation is not laying down “my way or the highway”!ultimatums. I don’t see any issues with what you are
asking and are similar to what I would propose.
But when you start the discussion in such a counterproductive way asserting your omnipotence, it’s a bad tact. Do you want to think about treating
me as an equal and not someone who works for you?
Sent:03/10/2024 at 01:02 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 01:19 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2065 of 4024
I know it happened on your watch. We were doing great before you said that you all would be divorcing me. You made it acceptable to not tell the
truth and treat me like a monster. He imitates what he sees.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 01:04 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 01:20 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Robotics
Message 2066 of 4024
Wow. I was trying to be helpful.
You are accusing me of influencing him.
I’m going to stop this conversation.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 01:21 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 01:22 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Robotics
Message 2067 of 4024
I appreciate the POV. But please climb down off your highnhorse long enough to read what I said and let me know if it is incorrect.
As mentioned before, we will have a much better relationship if when he imitates what he sees, it’s not vilification. That is all he sees now.
I’d like to work on that with you. Make sense?
That’s why I’m trying to find a way to be friendly
Sent:03/10/2024 at 01:26 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:16 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Robotics

Message 2068 of 4024
What time would you like to chat? I’m going to ask that we allocate the necessary time to do this justice. History tells us it’s time boxed for failure.
It’s a big deal that’s critical to the kid’s mental health that has drug on for months now. Let’s please make it matter when we discuss later and don’t cut
it short.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 01:34 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:16 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2069 of 4024

I’m talking to my lawyer tomorrow for my edits.
I don’t think talking about it will save money and will probably cause more ill will.
An RO was filed based on your conduct. This required limitations to time with kids.
You have now said if I truly believe it file charges.
A condition of the RO and not DV protection order was you admitting the behaviour.
I hear you will be denying it.
Please confirm and I will file charges as requested.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:26 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:31 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

Wow... we went from working constructively together to you filing charges so I can never work again. How did that happen? May you please turn on
calls for one moment. Your threats and actions out of nowhere when we were making great progress are certainly urgent. Let’s please not do this over

Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:34 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:45 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2071 of 4024

From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:45 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

Message 2072 of 4024

perfectly clear. so if you proceed and say something, I did not say then that’s on you. But I am telling you very clearly that you saying what you’re
saying is not correct.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:37 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:45 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

hold a job again?

From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:45 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

make a promise anymore clearly than what I’m saying. I have also sent no it below several times please don’t say that I am going to do something that
I’m telling you I will. I have said it several times I would like to negotiate in good faith with you and at a minimum have the dialogue with you on why
you feel the way you do? This is quite literally going to be ADs tuition. I have said I will negotiate in good faith.

Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:44 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:44 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

I’m not going to be manipulated by you.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:48 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:48 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2078 of 4024
To be very clear, Dr. Brown has the kids best interest in mind. If you choose to go directly against Dr. Brown’s recommendation based on talking to
us both and Adrian that’s your choice. But it definitely is not the kids best interest. I am not trying to manipulate you at all. I’m trying to have an
honest discussion in Goodwill. That’s not manipulation.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:49 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:50 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2079 of 4024
Then that is what you will see.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:50 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 02:54 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2080 of 4024
Please for once in this whole process stick to your word. And even if it’s not accepting the plan. Stick to your word that we would talk about it so we
can discuss it between ourselves before we spend $10,000 for our lawyers to solve something rephrasing what we’re trying to say that we could just say
to each other.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:54 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 04:43 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver
Message 2081 of 4024
It is impossible for me to see what Dr. Brown said when you say you’re pressing charges. She said flat out that is not in our children’s best interest.
You said very clearly below you are doing that. The two can’t happen concurrently. And, I told you very clearly that I would send you a parenting
plan that mirrors, Dr. Brown. If it does not, I am open to changing it. If that was somehow incorrect in its interpretation, I am more than happy to
change that but we don’t need $10,000 spent on lawyers to do something. I am already telling you I will do.
Sent:03/10/2024 at 02:56 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/10/2024 at 04:43 PM)
Subject:Re: Business solver

Message 2082 of 4024
Let's both just be measured, constructive and cooperative. I put the note below in the invite so I hope you agree.
One thing I will note that I am not sure resonates with you is that every single mental health professional we have ever seen, and Dr. Brown was the
most forceful and direct, said the attorneys are not trying to help us. They stir the pot and make money even if it destroys our children's lives. You
keep saying you want professional guidance but insist on doing the opposite with the most critical piece—the attorneys who keep making things

If you share ahead of time, as I offered to do with you on every occasion, I can see changes, and we walk through them more effectively. I'll have her
guidance to compare it with prior to the call. I assume we both track changes, so we are transparent and just do it.
We should aim to be as close to Dr Brown's guidance as possible and both be prepared, as she likes to say, to be "equally unhappy. " And if we don't
agree, it would be much more cost-effective and beneficial to our mental health to ask to schedule time with her.
